                                        double azimuth,
                                        double distance)
        Calculates a new IGeoPoint at the given azimuth and distance away from the source point
        Parameters:
        src - the source point
        azimuth - Azimuth in degrees True North
        distance - Meters
        Returns:
        the point computed based on the src, azimuth and distance

      • pointAtDistance

        public static IGeoPoint pointAtDistance​(IGeoPoint src,
                                        double azimuth,
                                        double distance,
                                        double inclination)
        Computes the destination point from the starting point, given an azimuth and distance in the direction of the destination point.

        The distance parameter ALWAYS represents surface distance, whether or not the inclination is NAN. This means that for computing slant points, distance does not equal the slant range.

        Parameters:
        src - Starting point of the calculation.
        azimuth - Azimuth in degrees (True North)
        distance - Surface distance between the start and destination point in meters
        inclination - from start point, NAN for surface only computation
        Returns:
        Destination point, if the point is antipodal from the starting point then the calculation could be off. Attempts to calculate the altitude from inclination.

      • pointAtDistance

      • magneticDeclination

        public static double magneticDeclination​(IGeoPoint point)
        Queries the declination angle between True North and Magnetic North at the given location at the given datetime.

        True bearing is computed by adding the declination value to the magnetic bearing.

        Parameters:
        point - GeoPoint for the location of the Compass.
        Returns:
        Bearing in degrees (True North)

      • magneticDeclination

        public static double magneticDeclination​(IGeoPoint point,
                                         long datetime)
        Queries the declination angle between True North and Magnetic North at the given location at the given datetime.

        True bearing is computed by adding the declination value to the magnetic bearing.

        Parameters:
        point - GeoPoint for the location of the Compass.
        datetime - The datetime in epoch milliseconds UTC
        Returns:
        Bearing in degrees (True North)

      • computeGridConvergence

        public static double computeGridConvergence​(IGeoPoint sPoint,
                                            IGeoPoint ePoint)

      • computeGridConvergence

        public static double computeGridConvergence​(IGeoPoint sPoint,
                                            double angle,
                                            double distance)
        Obtains the grid convergence used for a specific line of bearing.
        Parameters:
        sPoint - the starting point for the line of bearing.
        angle - the angle of the line of bearing.
        distance - the length of the line of bearing.
        Returns:
        the grid deviation (grid convergence) for the provided line of bearing. It is important to note that grid convergence cannot be acheived unless the line of bearing has some length. This will determine which grid line is used to converge against. The value is in angular degrees between [-180.0, 180.0)

      • haeToMsl

        public static double haeToMsl​(double lat,
                              double lon,
                              double alt)
        Retrieve the MSL in meters from HAE
        Parameters:
        lat - - Latitude of location to retrieve
        lon - - Longitude of location to retrieve
        alt - - existing Altitude in HAE only
        Returns:
        Altitude in MSL at specified point

        Parameters:

        lon - the longitude

        Returns:

      • geoidHeight

        public static double geoidHeight​(double latitude,
                                 double longitude)
        Retrieve the offset between the HAE and MSL values
        Parameters:
        latitude - Latitude of location to retrieve
        longitude - Longitude of location to retrieve
        Returns:
        Delta between the HAE and MSL values, or Double.NaN if the area is not valid.
